Adam, can you suggest any steps?  I realize you didn't notice the error until 
long after you caused it.

It looks like it happened on startup, the view was previously active and being 
hidden, widgets are being released, and along the way we try to set the title.

We should at least put in better error handling on this route.

James:
Perhaps we can improve HistoryView.IStructuredContentProvider.inputChanged() to 
be more defensive. Right now it checks

    if (oldInput == null && newInput == null) return;

which I don't understand the purpose of, perhaps that should be || not &&?
Other implementors of inputChanged() don't appear to be particularly defensive 
wrt. the widget already being disposed.

I tried the following steps with no error:
- opened history view as fast view
- with fast view still open, shut down workbench
- restarted it

sorry - no idea whatsoever
i looked at the log after some other bug caused an exception
HistoryView should not be doing any widget work in inputChanged().
*** Bug 8860 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
